items.title: Live: Gun laws pass lower house, Labor introduces hate reforms
items.description: The gun laws, which include stricter checks during firearm licence applications and a national gun buyback scheme, will now move to the Senate, where they're expected to pass with the support of the Greens. Follow live.

items.title: Breaking: Surfer bitten by shark on NSW Mid North Coast
items.description: The 39-year-old man was surfing at Point Plomer, near Crescent Head, this morning when the shark bit through his board.

items.title: 'There'll be more': Shark warning after four attacks in 48 hours
items.description: A public policy shark expert says sewage leaking into the harbour after heavy rainfall is attracting bait fish followed by sharks.

items.title: Origin extends life of Australia's largest coal-fired power station
items.description: The operator of Australia's largest coal-fired power station is to extend the life of its plant in the NSW Hunter Valley for another two years.

items.title: British-born Aussies give up UK citizenship in response to passport rules
items.description: Frustrated dual British-Australian citizens are weighing up their options in response to new passport rules. Here's why some are letting go of their British citizenship.

items.title: Donald Trump's text message to Norway's PM, line by line
items.description: The message states Mr Trump "no longer [feels] an obligation to think purely of Peace" after being denied the Nobel Peace Prize. We've analysed the rest of the US president's claims to see if they stack up.

items.title: Trump goes to Davos as bond market vigilantes plot against him
items.description: There are signs Donald Trump's bold strategy to artificially lower interest rates could backfire, as a level of disquiet emerges on money markets, particularly in bonds.

items.title: Labor 'really close' to deal with Liberals on hate speech laws, Burke says
items.description: Liberal MPs gathered to discuss the draft laws at a party room meeting in Canberra on Monday evening after Opposition Leader Sussan Ley and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese met to hash out an agreement.

items.title: Women's football captain departs club over offensive 'Silly Saturday' costumes
items.description: A women's senior football captain has stepped away from her local club after photos of the senior men's leadership team were posted online during their "Silly Saturday" post-season celebrations.

items.title: Breaking: Two dead as car and train collide at level crossing west of Geelong
items.description: The crash between the car and a freight train happened at a level crossing near the small town of Cressy at about 10am on Tuesday.

items.title: Live: Locals hunting maiden Aus Open wins as trio of champions take centre stage
items.description: US-born Maya Joint is one of the local favourites on court to start day three of the Australian Open, looking to win a main draw match at her home slam for the first time. Follow live.

items.title: 12yo girl and two others dead after fiery late-night ute crash
items.description: Police believe two large utes, a Dodge Ram and Ford Ranger, collided on the Bunya Highway at Taabinga, about 200 kilometres north-west of Brisbane.

items.title: Brisbane hit by vaccine shortages after wall collapses at warehouse
items.description: Brisbane parents are being turned away from GP clinics due to a shortage of childhood vaccines.

items.title: China's birth rate has hit a record low. Experts say it spells long-term trouble
items.description: National data shows that in 2025, China's population shrank by 3.39 million people, as experts warn the trend is likely to continue.

items.title: First Nations woman asked about eating ants takes department to court
items.description: A First Nations employee at South Australia's Department for Infrastructure and Transport (DIT) has claimed she was sexually harassed by her supervisor and racially discriminated against when asked about eating ants before a cultural training session, court documents reveal.

items.title: Italian fashion designer Valentino dies aged 93 in Rome
items.description: The fashion icon's creations were adored by Hollywood stars, royals and first ladies for his fail-safe red carpet designs.

items.title: Live: ASX opens in the red, IMF calls out Australia's 'drawn-out' inflation
items.description: The ASX opens down. The International Monetary Fund says Australia, alongside Norway, is projected to see persistent above-target inflation. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Military jammers that shut down Starlink in Iran 'most likely' from Russia
items.description: In Iran, Starlink has provided a line to the outside world, but now there are fears about such vital technology being in the hands of one company.

items.title: How a lion crushed a Datsun with newlyweds inside in Adelaide
items.description: The pair had made an on-the-spot decision on the way home from their honeymoon to visit a drive-through safari park where lions roamed free — and their little brown Datsun came out worse for wear.

items.title: Swimmers urged to check pollution in Port Phillip before diving in
items.description: Victoria's Environment Protection Authority says people wanting to cool off at bay beaches this summer should stay across its regular pollution updates.

items.title: Victoria's CFA funding reaches five-year high, despite cut claims
items.description: Government funding of Victoria's Country Fire Authority rose by more than $20 million last financial year according to the CFA's annual report.

items.title: What we know so far about Spain's fatal high-speed train crash
items.description: Spanish authorities have declared three days of mourning after two trains collided on a track south of Madrid, killing at least 40 people.

items.title: Australia's 'ghost nets' program expands to heavily fished northern seas
items.description: A $25 million funding injection will help expand the Top End's war on ghost nets, as ranger groups shift focus to the heavily fished seas to Australia's north.

items.title: Basil Zempilas using fishing ban to batter WA government
items.description: While many West Australians were competing for parking spots at beaches on their holidays, Basil Zempilas latched onto two hot topics on which to challenge the government — the demersal fishing ban and WA's illicit tobacco trade.

items.title: Man found dead in back of car near Corowa hospital
items.description: A police investigation is underway after a man was found dead inside a car near a hospital on the NSW–Victoria border.
